column4: my right clicker is not working on my mouse, how would i access the panel to remove a icon
are you trying to remove a file or folder from your desktop, or something from your menus?
sorry, I got it now. the panel...
I know how to remove something from the panel without right click. I wouldn't say it's the right way, and might leave some mess
run gconf-editor in a terminal. go to apps >> panle
Some things on the panel are applets and some are objects. Use this with caution, because it won't warn you if you do something dumb.
i dont think i can remove a specific icon from the editor
you can, but it's not always obvious how. A safer option might be to try to use accessibility modes to fake a right click.
or go and get a mouse with more than one button   ;)
you need to update and upgrade
where did the kernel come from?
why would you be on lucid?
are you trying to install from the old-releases.ubuntu.com server?
but that is an EOL distro, so the update servers have changed.
